hackathon-description-text: Hack HSV is Alabama's first high school hackathon: a 12-hour coding marathon where you will collaborate with friends to solve a space-themed problem
hackathon-eligibility: Students 13-18 from any part of the world is eligible to join!
hackathon-requirements: Students are able to program in any language they know, on any platform. This can span from C++, to Swift, to even Scratch. Using this, you will be creating a solution to a problem, which will be announced at the competition, that has to do with space. You will be submitting the final products here on Devpost where judges and students will be able to see your awesome creations!
hackathon-rules: You can find all the rules during registration.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winner with the highest score, as decided by the judges, will win this prize
The most popular project, as voted on by the hackers on Devpost, will win this award
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Popular Prize - Amazon Alexa Dot

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=4915 Garth Rd SE, Huntsville, AL 35802, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: (20) How creative and unique is your project and your solution?
(20) How well does this solve the problem that will be announced?
(10) How well did you show off your awesome project?
(10) Overall, how clean, and well designed is your project?

hackathon-location-address: 4915 Garth Rd SE, Huntsville, AL 35802, USA
hackathon-description-header: Students come to Hack HSV to build space-themed projects, transform dreams into realities, and to meet others with the same level of passion to build their future. Hack HSV is for creators.
